BiblioData.Title: Method for cost- efficient manufacturing diamond tips for ultra- high resolution electrical measurements and devices obtained thereof
BiblioData.Abstract: An Atomic Force Microscopy probe configuration (6) is disclosed, comprising a cantilever (8), and a planar tip (19) attached to the cantilever (8), which only partially overlaps the planar tip (19), and extending along a longitudinal direction (x) thereof. The planar tip (19) is of a two-dimensional geometry having at least one corner (20) remote from the cantilever (8), which corner (20) during use contacts a surface (18) to be scanned.

Claims.P: 1. An Atomic Force Microscopy probe configuration (6), comprising;
- a cantilever (8), and
- a planar tip (19) attached at least to a sidewall (13) of the cantilever (8), and extending along a longitudinal direction (x) thereof.
2. The probe configuration (6) according to claim 1,
wherein:
the planar tip (19) is of a two-dimensional geometry having at least one corner (20) remote from the cantilever (8), which corner (20) during use contacts a surface (18) to be scanned.
3. The probe configuration (6) according to claim 2,
wherein:
the planar tip (19) is triangular shaped.
4. The probe configuration (6) according to any of the foregoing claims, wherein:
the planar tip (19) is formed of diamond (17).
5. The probe configuration (6) according to any of the claims 1 to 3, wherein:
at least the remote corner (20) of the planar tip (19) is covered with a diamond layer (16).
6. The probe configuration (6) according to claim 5,
wherein:
the planar tip (19) and the cantilever (8) are formed of the same material.
7. The probe configuration (6) according to any of the claims 4, 5 or 6, wherein:
diamond nano-crystallites (21) protrude from the diamond surface (24).
8. The probe configuration (6) according to any of claims 4,5,6 or 7, wherein:
the diamond layer is boron-doped.
9. The probe configuration (6) according to any of the foregoing claims, wherein the cantilever (8) further comprises;
- a mirror (25) on a major surface (12) thereof,
- the mirror (25) having a reflecting surface (29) perpendicular to this major surface (12) and perpendicular to the longitudinal direction (x) of the cantilever (8).

10. A method for forming an Atomic Force Microscopy probe configuration (6), comprising a cantilever (8) and a planar tip (19) attached to a sidewall (13) of the cantilever (8) and extending along a longitudinal direction (x) thereof, the method comprising:
- providing a flat substrate (14),
- forming a planar diamond layer (16) on this flat substrate (14),
- forming the planar tip (19) by patterning (17) this planar diamond layer (16) in a two-dimensional geometry having at least one corner (20),
- releasing the planar tip (19) from the flat substrate (14), and
- attaching the released planar tip (19) to a sidewall (13) of the cantilever (8), such that the at least one corner (20) being remote from the cantilever (8).
11. The method according to claim 10, further comprising
- forming on the flat substrate (14) a layer of a material which can be etched at least selectively to diamond (17), and
- wherein releasing the planar tip comprises underetching the patterned diamond layer (17) by etching this selectively removable layer.
12. The method according to any of the claims 10 or 11,
wherein;
forming the planar diamond layer (16) comprises:
- forming on the flat substrate (14) a pattern of nanometer-sized diamond particles,
- growing a diamond layer (16) using these diamond particles as seeds, and wherein;
forming the planar tip (19) comprises
- patterning the diamond layer (16) such that the at least one corner (20) is located at the location of one diamond particle.
13. The method according to any of the claims 10, 11 or 12, further comprising the step of:
- forming a mirror (25) on a major surface (12) of the cantilever (8),
- the mirror (25) having a reflecting surface (29) perpendicular to this major surface (12) and perpendicular to the longitudinal direction of the cantilever (8).
